alert.note: Alert for Bledsoe; Meigs; Rhea (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 27 at 3:21PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN RHEA...CENTRAL BLEDSOE AND WEST CENTRAL MEIGS COUNTIES THROUGH 500 PM EDT/400 PM CDT/... At 421 PM EDT/321 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Pikeville, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Dayton, Pikeville, Graysville, Evensville, Old Washington, Brayton, Mount Crest, Old Cumberland, and Fall Creek Falls State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
